subtitle: in 1950 Dr Abraham Jacob Weintraub left
France for Sri Lanka and India with the
intention of staying only two months to
meet with spiritual Masters in
particular with Ramana Maharishi and SRI
aurobindo as fate would have it he met
ma anandamayi soon after his arrival
following this meeting he decided to
follow the holy woman and later became a
monk or Swami in Ma's organization
taking the name of Swami vijayananda the
victory of bliss
Swami vijayananda never returned to
France and spent nearly 60 years in
India including 17 years as a Hermit in
the mountains of the Himalayas this
Jyoti grappaire or sweet grandfather as
some French followers like to call him
welcomed westerners to Mars ashram in
kankal where the tomb of anandmaima is
located until his death on April 5th
2010 at the age of 95 today Swami
vijayananda is an object of veneration
for Christians Jews Buddhists Hindus and
others at his grave in peer La shares
serving as a bridge between East and
West as well as a central element to the
worship of Ananda Mai MAA
[Music]
just imagine that a tree a beautiful
strong old beach for instance approaches
you with calm steps what would you feel
oh I have gone crazy you would think or
perhaps I am dreaming you would wonder
finally when you realize that you are
neither dreaming nor are you seeing an
illusion you will understand you have
entered a new dimension of reality this
is how the German novelist Malita mashma
described her first encounter with
Ananda mahima in her book encountering
Bliss my journey through India with
Ananda mahima ma anandamayi is
considered a true Giant in Indian
spirituality who is revered by people in
the East and the West alike as one among
the great Saints of Modern India along
with Saints like ramakrishna Vivekananda
aurobind nagosh Ramana Maharishi and
paramahansa Yogananda foreign
[Music]
literally means Bliss permeated mother
it was as early as 1920s that people
close to her began to realize the
essence of mother Divine in her and
started calling her mataji or often just
ma it was one of her early disciples
called bhaiyaji who gave her the title
of ma anandamayi meaning mother full of
bliss soon people all over the country
and from different quarters of the world
who flocked to her for Spiritual
illumination started calling her Ananda
mahima or Bliss permeated mother
on April 30 1896 in a remote rural
Village of cura in East Bengal a girl
child was born to a poor but devout
vaishnava Brahman couple they named her
nirmala sundari meaning Immaculate
beauty or daintless beauty
according to Professor bithika Mukherjee
the principal biographer of Ananda
mahima she was a very detached child
right from her early years showing
little interest in her surrounding
environment people often thought she was
intellectually challenged but this
Detachment did not mean any withdrawal
from life nirmala sundari was indeed a
very happy child she communed with
animals and trees like Saint Francis of
Assisi and often fell into spiritual
chances at the age of 13 nirmala sundari
was married to a much older person
ramani Mohan chakravarti he later became
her disciple and she called him
bholenath one of the names of Lord Shiva
ma went through her marriage life with
complete commitment treating her husband
like a devoted wife but she never
consummated her marriage with sexual
Union or procreation it is said that
whenever the thoughts of physical
attraction and lust occurred to her
husband Ma's body would assume the
terrible and awe-inspiring form of the
Goddess Kali and the poor husband would
retreat in submission and guilt
bholenath was troubled and frustrated at
first but was gradually convinced that
his wife was in fact a manifestation of
the Divine mother he later took
spiritual initiation from his wife and
began to relate to her as his Guru in a
remarkable reversal from the perspective
of Dharma shastra or the Hindu code he
spent the rest of his life as his wife's
disciple caring for her physical
well-being as she seemed completely
uninterested in her body and mediating
between her and her growing number of
devotees ma in fact distanced herself
from the traditional role of a Hindu
married woman and broke the ideal of the
perfect Hindu woman or pativrata by her
refusal to throw the line Karen peculus
who undertook an interesting study on
the female gurus in Asia considers this
refusal of the socially defined role of
a woman as a key instrumental element in
conferring the charismatic status
among other female saints and gurus
[Music]
in 1918 at the age of 22 ma moved with
her husband to bajatpur in eastern
Bengal there she initiated an intense
and prolonged phase of spiritual
self-discipline or sadhana unlike other
sages and yogic Masters she never
received any direction or lessons from a
guru she taught herself and was able to
perform the varied yogic postures asanas
and symbolic and ritualistic gestures
mudras all by herself
spontaneously ma called this face
sadhana Leela Leela means play or game
for ma there was nothing to be attained
spiritually through sadhna although she
learned practiced and perfected it
without any Masters her state had always
been one of spiritual realization
according to ma like the famous Sanskrit
scholar and theologian Professor
gopinath kaviraj whose writings were
instrumental in exposing the spiritual
power of the this illiterate woman to
the academic world observed samadhi or
no samadhi she is where she always has
been she knows no change no modification
no alteration she is always poised in
the self-same awareness as a supreme and
integral universality
[Music]
Ananda mahima continued her sadhana for
self-disciplining and that eventually
led into her initiation on August 3rd
1922 ma conducted her own initiation
simultaneously becoming the disciple
shisha the master Guru and the Divinity
ishta all the intricate rituals as laid
down in the scriptures were
spontaneously performed by her to detail
later ma said on her initiation as the
master Guru I revealed the Mantra as a
disciple shisha I accepted it and
started to recite it the Mantra now
replaced the names of God which I had
been repeating earlier as the
realization dawned within me that the
master the Mantra the Lord ishta and the
disciple are one by this unconventional
Act of self-initiation
distinguished herself from most of the
gurus and sages and became an
exceptional saint
[Music]
in 1924 Ananda mahima moved to Dhaka the
capital city of Bangladesh with her
husband it is during this period that
people started recognizing her spiritual
Mastery and the first disciples flocked
to her including bayaji who first called
her ma anandamayi describing her as the
mother saturated with joy slowly but
steadily the number of people who
recognized her spiritual prowess
increased and people far and white began
to hear about her spiritual ecstasies
and started coming to meet her and seek
spiritual counsel many saw her as an
incarnation of the Divine mother others
saw her as a being that had attained the
perfect realization jivan mukta a good
number of people flocked to her hearing
of her reputation and wanted to see her
perform Miracles Clairvoyance and
healing
foreign
from the early 1930 onwards ma started
traveling throughout the country
visiting temples and holy sites and
meeting with her devotees her life
became an unending procession of
religious gatherings such Sons for the
rest of her mundane life ma followed
this pattern of traveling and meeting
leading the life of a renouncement and a
spiritual Guru to her followers she
interacted with strange crowds as a
spiritual guide and spoke about
spiritual matters with authority all the
while referring to herself as a little
girl her Fame spread slowly but steadily
and many scholars and sages wanted to
know about her and came to meet her to
their surprise she spoke to them with
ease and Authority about even the most
complex philosophical Concepts they
could instantly recognize the higher
state of spiritual elevation this
illiterate girl had attained during the
next few years many prominent people
bengalis and non-bingolis alike had the
opportunity to meet Ma and become her
devotees in 1933 kamla nehru wife of
Pandit jawaharlal nehru met Ma and
became her devotee kamla's daughter
Indira Gandhi future Prime Minister of
India would come to seek Ma's spiritual
guidance throughout her life other
well-known Indian devotees who met ma
during this period included the Saint
shivananda the yogi Yogananda and
Mahatma Gandhi as well as numerous
politicians including the president of
the Republic Dr rajendra Prasad and the
vice president and philosopher
sarvapalli radhakrishnan and Pandit
nehru within the ensuing decades many
European visitors to India had mass
darshan and became her devotees Ma's
foremost foreign devotees include
Abraham Jacob Weintraub a French
physician now Swami vijayananda British
photographer Richard lanoi and the
French film producer Arno dijonday in
her pilgrimages throughout India ma
attracted a vast number of followers and
although she never encouraged it ashrams
were constructed to welcome her an
organization was created in 1952 the SRI
SRI Ananda my Sangha making ma the first
woman in the history of India to be
represented by a movement of such size
[Music]
oh
while on a visit to India in 1936 Guru
paramahansa Yogananda the founder of
self-realization Fellowship in America
and the world-renowned teacher of kreya
yoga went to meet Ananda my ma as
suggested by his niece the moment ma saw
him she got down from the car she had
got in as she was about to go on a
journey and walked up to him saying
aloud in childlike Joy father finally
you have come Guru Yogananda was
surprised by this as he was meeting her
for the first time sometime later at his
request ma visited him in his school in
Ranchi in his book autobiography of a
yogi Yogananda describes how MA
responded when asked to tell something
about herself there is so little to tell
father before I came on this Earth
father I was the same as a little girl I
was the same I grew into Womanhood but
still I was the same even afterwards
through the dance of creation changes
around me in the Hall of Eternity I
shall be the same
fully convinced of Ma's Divinity
Yogananda remark that Ananda maima was
always one with the eternal
in the last decade of her life Ananda
mahima's devotees numbered in the
hundreds of thousands and ashram's
hospitals and schools had been
established in her name all over India
at the age of 86 on August 28 1982 ma
took Maha samadhi or passed from the
physical world in her ashram and
dehradun next day in accordance with
Ma's wishes her body was taken in A
procession tended by thousands in
mourning to kankal ashraman haridwar on
Sunday August 29 ma anandamayi was
buried as a realized being and ever
since her Shrine has become a place of
worship and pilgrimage renowned for its
spiritual power her ashrams continued to
function in honor of her headed by
various male renouncers or sannyasins
and run loudly by celibate women or
brahmacharins her thousands of household
devotees worship her daily in their
homes and gather his each week to
participate in spiritual practices in
her name
[Music]
is life and teachings do not yield to
easy categorization and labels various
disciples Scholars and observers of her
life and work have wondered if ma was
just an extraordinary mistake or an
avtara or is she in fact the absolute
self in bodily manifestation in the
words of her Italian devotee Miriam or
mother is not a human being like all the
others she is divine light clad in a
human form Alexander lipsky in his book
on Ma makes a curious observation that
though many a skilled photographer has
tried to capture Ananda mahima most of
the pictures had turned out to be very
distinctly different lipsky likes to
conclude that we are witnessing in her
person the infinitely varying aspects of
the cosmos the spiritual teachings of
Ananda mahima likewise defy labels and
cannot be said to belong to any
particular School of Indian philosophy
never thought of herself as a guru and
constantly called herself this little
girl but at the same time she gave
spiritual counseling and instructions
her method of teaching was simple she
chose a simple language and spoke often
through Parables like SRI ramakrishna
did or like Jesus Christ according to ma
irrespective of which religious path one
Embraces the aim of religion must be to
pierce through the veil of delusion to
discover the underlying Oneness and
ultimately to merge with the one this is
the foremost nay the only duty of man we
may try to summarize the teachings of
anandmaima as focusing on two Central
themes on self-realization and on action
she often reiterated that the Supreme
calling of every person is to try and
Achieve self-realization and that all
other obligations in life are secondary
the true goal of our life on this Earth
is to realize God by knowing oneself
hence the actions that we do in our
daily lives should be those which help
us realize our divine nature Mark
constantly spoke of the quest of finding
our true self as our only possible way
to escape from sansara and Karma the
endless cycles of rebirth in this world
of illusory reality it is clear that
even as she did not subscribe to any
particular School her teachings
corresponded to the philosophy of
non-duality her teachings essentially
followed the path of shankara's modest
tradition of advaithya ma always spoke
of herself in the third person calling
herself as this body or this little girl
an indication of the non-dual thoughts
she practiced
anandam oblis is a highly philosophical
idea in Indian tradition God or the
absolute is described as sachitananda a
fusion of existence Consciousness and
Bliss thus in Indian philosophical
tradition Bliss is not just Joy or
happiness it is the ultimate
manifestation of God himself this is the
reason why Ananda mahima the Bliss
permeated mother was considered to be
the manifestation of the Divine Mother
by her disciples the Bliss ma propagated
and emanated was the higher state of
self-realization attainable by everyone
through proper sadhana and proper living
so hard
the life of the Blissful mother is an
eloquent testimony to the abiding
strength of Indian spirituality ma
anandama's message is particularly
appropriate in a world where the notion
of progress is no longer taken from
gospel truth and the whole array of our
modern values is undergoing an agonizing
reappraisal anandamaima's diagnosis the
present disease of civilization as over
secularization she suggests that The
Cure from our severe illness cannot be
brought about by engineers sociologists
and psychologists but by doctors of the
Soul she prescribed a drastic revolution
in our views and attitudes from
outwardness to inwardness from
materialism to spirituality and from man
centeredness to god-centeredness
observes Alexander lipsky
foreign
[Music]
is now generally regarded as the very
incarnation of bliss a supreme
manifestation of the Divine mother she
continues to teach and guide thousands
of her followers even today the Supreme
lesson of bliss she taught by example
lives on where Bliss Reigns fear must
vanish says Alexander lipsky of Mars
Legacy
was the embodiment of the truth
proclaimed by tetrio upanishad from Joy
Springs the universe Ma's presence is
external in this world in her own words
one who passes away in fact merges into
the one who is Ever existent Ananda
mahima the mother of bliss is indeed
ever existent
[Music]
